text:
that’s a pretty cool idea. though everyone’s reading speed is different so whether it has any weight to site visitors at all idk.

theoretically you can use javascript to detect top of the article, then detect the bottom, and divide your time calculation by the percentage the user has scrolled between the top and bottom
personally my opinion on it is that showing a reading time might cause people to leave before finishing reading, because it’s a constant reminder that your content is taking up their time.
